CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ruth Furno, housewife, McDonald, Pa, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that we are spending too much money for foreign aid? Do you think that what we have spent has halted the spread of communism?" answer reads: "I feel that if we put more trust in God and more money at home, that we will be better off.  To a certain degree, the money which we have given to countries has checked communism, but we should try to halt this spread of communism in our country."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruth Furno wearing light colored blouse and light colored overcoat with floral lining, standing on corner of Liberty Avenue and Wood Street with sign that reads "... H. Alexander & Co." stationary, Downtown
